Eyes: Objects look smaller than they are
Stomach: Fermentation, much flatulence; constriction; ravenous hunger; persistent nausea, with anxiety and weakness
Head: Cramp-like, squeezing pain
Tense, pressing pain, confined to a small spot
Constriction about forehead and right temples
Numbness, with headache
Mind: Physical symptoms disappear as mental symptoms develop
Mental troubles, associated with suppressed menses
Stool: Adheres to rectum, like soft clay
Retarded; faeces scanty; evacuated with difficulty
Constipation of travelers, who are constantly changing food and water
Abdomen: Pressing and bearing down in abdomen, extending into pelvis
Pain in umbilical region; extending through to back
Face: Prosopalgia, with numb feeling in malar bones, as if the parts were between screws
Coldness, creeping, and numbness, in whole right side of face
Pain at root of nose, as if squeezed in a vise
Female: Menses too early, too profuse, dark-clotted, with spasms and painful bearing-down, chilliness, and sensitiveness of parts
Extremities: Tightness of thighs, as if too tightly wrapped

name: Platina
Relationship: Antidote: PULS. Platina antidotes the bad effects of lead.Compare: RHODIUM; STANN.; VALER.; SEP. Compare, also: PLATINUM MURIATICUM (this remedy has achieved beneficial results after Iodine of Potash failed to cure in syphilitic affection; violent occipital headaches, dysphagia, and syphilitic throat and bone affections; caries of bones of feet); PLAT. MUR. NAT. (polyuria and salivation); SEDUM ACRE (sexual irritability, relieves irritation of nerve centers and gives rest).
details: Is pre-eminently a woman's remedy. Strong tendency to paralysis, anaesthesia, localized NUMBNESS AND COLDNESS are shown. Hysterical spasms; pains increase and decrease gradually. (STANNUM.) Tremulousness.
